qas.question: What type of wood is preferred as fuel?
What type of wood burns quickly and makes more smoke than hardwood?
What type of areas use more wood for fuel?
What benefit besides the cozy atmosphere would a wood-burning fireplace add to a home?

context: Wood has a long history of being used as fuel, which continues to this day, mostly in <a2_0>rural<a2_0/> areas of the world. <a0_0>Hardwood<a0_0/> is preferred over <a1_0>softwood<a1_0/> because it creates less smoke and burns longer. Adding a woodstove or fireplace to a home is often felt to add ambiance and <a3_0>warmth<a3_0/>.
